name: Adonis
description:
// A vine charcoal drawing salvaged from art school '99, Firenze, Italia; fused with Martian Morning Clouds: NASA JPL PIA17940, photo taken by Viking Orbiter 1, Aug. 17, 1976 //

Accompanying Poem by MCN:

I, Adonis
Guided by Venus.

This, it’s the mythica
blah blah blah blah, boom shaka
don't worry, never sick of ya
balloon on the bus, thus
It be.

Street eats, cancel defeat
Wheat n beets, served on the platter
Amongst the chatter, o simpletons
Worried sons a, Slip into it
A grid of blissfulness.

Twist the mist and turn this hiss
Into a grin, never left behind
Among orange rinds
Above, below, within.

All that air and hair everywhere, and wavy
Saved me from the screw, and nail,
Save me.

Garbage pail to the rhythm, 
A banging schizm, opened up
Wide eyes, ecstatic cries
Mouth and sunshine
Bolts and nuts.

The musical mystics, 
in night air.
The sky, the stars
The smell of her hair.

I, Adonis
And Venus.
